text:
Joey Lynn King (born July 30, 1999) is an American actress, singer and model, who is perhaps best known for her most prominent roles as Ramona Quimby in "Ramona and Beezus". King also appeared in "The Dark Knight Rises", "Oz the Great and Powerful", "Family Weekend", "White House Down", "The Conjuring" and in the "The Kissing Booth" movie series.
King was nominated for a Golden Globe Award, SAG Award and a Satellite Award for her role as Gypsy Blanchard in the limited crime drama "The Act" in 2020.
She has won a Young Artist Award. Her entire showbiz and entertainment career officially began in 2002.
King was born on July 30, 1999 in Los Angeles, California. She was raised in Los Angeles, California. King has also stated that she is "part Jewish and part Christian, but she's more and mostly Jewish".
